column2: ENGLISH
Approve the plan
The plot succeeded!
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! is not satisfied, the plot continues...
The plot succeeds
The plot succeeds but is revealed
The troops are sent
Tell [This.GetTitledName] of the idea to increase the revolt risk in the demesne of [This.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]
Ask §Y[This.GetTitledName]§! for funds to increase the revolt risk in the demesne of §Y[This.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]§!

With the informations I collected, I could help foment the rebellion [plot_leader.GetTitledName] wants. I know that a lot of peasants could become discontent with [plot_leader.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] if I were to push them a bit, increasing the risk of them revolting!
I know someone there that could accomplish more with some help.
Maybe [plot_leader.GetTitledFirstName] could fund troublemakers.
Pay the local leaders to be more persuasive.
This is not worth doing.

Good news! My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName], has let me know that [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] will soon hear angry peasants knocking at [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] door! He has indeed found a way to make the peasants believe that their liege isn't fulfilling [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] duties as [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitle].
Nice job, let's go with this.
The plot leader [From.GetTitledName] is telling me that I can go along with the plan. I have means to make the peasants of the [target_title.GetFullBaseName] angry now...
Fire up the rebels.

[From.GetTitledName] has successfully increased the revolt risk in the [target_title.GetFullBaseName] without getting my plans revealed. The peasants are now angry and will, hopefully, be revolting soon!
Perfect, that ought to do it.
This isn't the end...

[From.GetTitledName] has successfully increased the revolt risk in the [target_title.GetFullBaseName] but [From.GetHeShe] got my plans revealed in the process! The peasants are now angry and will, hopefully, be revolting soon!
Well, at least the plan worked.
[From.GetTitledName] has a way to make progress in my plot to Foment the Rebellion against [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] just needs money to do so.
Fund what's needed.
Fund more to ensure it goes well.
Don't give anything.
The plot leader [From.GetTitledName] doesn't want to pay to help me accomplish his own plot! If this opportunity has to happen, it will be thanks to me!
With the informations I collected, I could help the current rebellion against [plot_leader.PlotTarget.GetTitledName], continuing the plot of [plot_leader.GetTitledName].
Send my men under their flag.
Stir up more revolters.
Pay mercenaries to help the revolt.
Pay a lot of mercaneries help the revolt.
This is not worth doing.
My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName], has gathered troops ready to fight against [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]. Let's use them to help...
[TOW_Plot_9_revolt_1.GetTitledName].
[TOW_Plot_9_revolt_2.GetTitledName].
[TOW_Plot_9_revolt_3.GetTitledName].
[TOW_Plot_9_revolt_4.GetTitledName].
There are no revolts against [plot_leader.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] anymore.
The measures to help a rebellion are cancelled.
The plot leader [From.GetTitledName] is telling me that I can go along with the plan. The troops are ready.
Send them!
A band of warriors have come to help me in my cause! [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is truly with me!
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! gets more troops
[From.GetTitledName] got the troops that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] sent. My plot has succeeded !
[Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] is in trouble!
[From.GetTitledName] got the troops that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] sent. My plot has succeeded but unfortunately has been revealed !
Whoops.
